stories.original_headline: Want to link from Google’s app store to your app? That’ll be $2–4 per install
stories.original_summary: Today was the deadline for Google to reveal how it's complying with Judge James Donato's order to crack open Android for third-party app stores, stop illegally tying its Google Play Billing system to its app store, and let developers link to ways to download their apps outside the Play Store in the
stories.fantasy_headline: Royal Archive Demands Gold for Linking Enchantments
stories.fantasy_story: The Grand Royal Archive of Enchantments has revealed new dictates. Scribes' Guilds must now pay a few gold coins for each magical scroll linked from the archive's own register. This decision follows a Royal Magistrate's decree to open more pathways for sharing rare enchantments.

stories.original_headline: Google is part of Movies Anywhere again
stories.original_summary: Google is once again part of Movies Anywhere, meaning that movies you've purchased from Google Play and YouTube will now show up as part of your Movies Anywhere collection. Films from Google Play and YouTube became unavailable on Movies Anywhere on October 31st, but now they should sync to your acco
stories.fantasy_headline: Chroniclers' Guild Rejoins Infinite Scroll Repository
stories.fantasy_story: The Grand Chroniclers' Guild has proudly rejoined the Infinite Scroll Repository! This means all the moving pictures and ancient sagas acquired from the Whispering Crystal Scryer will now appear in your personal collection. These treasured tales were briefly lost but are now syncing once more for all to enjoy.
